grammarTopics.title: Simple Present Tense
grammarTopics.description: We use this to talk about habits, facts, and things that are always true.
grammarTopics.tip: Add 's' for he, she, it: 'He reads every day.'

sentences: The sun rises in the east.
realWorld: A restaurant menu says: 'This dish comes with salad.'
A school notice says: 'Classes start at 8 AM.'

grammarTopics.title: Present Continuous Tense
grammarTopics.description: We use this to talk about things happening right now.

sentences: I am studying for my exam.
They are playing football in the park.
realWorld: A student says: 'I’m working on my homework now.'
A friend texts: 'We’re watching a movie!'

grammarTopics.title: Past Simple Tense
grammarTopics.description: We use this to talk about things that happened before now.
grammarTopics.tip: Use past verb forms like 'walked' or 'went.'

sentences: He watched a movie last night.
realWorld: A diary says: 'Today was amazing. I saw a rainbow!'
A news report says: 'The concert ended at 10 PM.'

grammarTopics.title: Articles: a, an, the
grammarTopics.description: We use 'a' or 'an' for something general, and 'the' for something specific.
grammarTopics.tip: Use 'an' before a vowel sound: 'an apple.'

sentences: I saw a cat in the garden.
realWorld: A product label says: 'This is an excellent choice.'
A teacher says: 'Open the book to page 12.'

grammarTopics.title: Prepositions of Place
grammarTopics.description: We use these to show where something is.
grammarTopics.tip: Common prepositions: in, on, under, next to.

sentences: The keys are on the table.
realWorld: A sign says: 'Please wait behind the line.'
A friend says: 'Your bag is under the chair.'
